page.title: 01Around Wooded North Shipley
page.content: The A272 road, busy with motor traffic, runs roughly parallel with the Southern boundary of he block.. it is in great contrast to the twisting lanes which connect the hamlets of Dragons reen and Brook Green, eventually connecting with Southwater, a larger village at the north-eastern corner densely built upon by developers. The lanes, fringed with deciduous trees, meander through farm land and 350 acres of managed woodlands, consisting of mixed blocks of hardwood conifers. The conifers were planted in 1950 and will be sold when mature, to be replacded by hard wood tree. The residents of the area are a mixture of retired people,tenant farmers agricultural workers and those who have a variety of occupations in nearby towns. There are a number of ancient houses and cottages
